text: NARRATOR: The oldest stories ever toldare written in the stars.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Stories of time before man and gods,when Titans ruled the earth.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...but their reign was endedby their own sons...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...to create a beast so strongit could defeat their parents.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Zeus became king of the heavens.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...was left to rule the underworldin darkness and in misery.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It was Zeus who created man...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But in time, mankind grew restless.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: They began to question the gods...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Into this world, a child was born.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: A boy who would change everything.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I'll have a brother or a sister soon.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Think we're gonna love this child differentlyto the way we love you? We won't.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I am your father, Perseus.Marmara is your mother.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And you'll always be our son.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The bond between usis much more than flesh and bone.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The love we have for you...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...it's that love that gods and kingsfight over.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But even I don't questionthat you were saved for a reason.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...that reason is gonna take youfar away from here.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: To whom do I direct our gratitudefor this glorious bounty?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Poseidon, Zeus?Who do I thank, Marmara?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - Thank the men who provoke them.SPYROS: They crush my island.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: They put a plague on yours.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: They take from us what they want.We're their slaves.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - For that, we should be thankful.- I'm tired of being thankful for scraps.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I'm a fisherman. Perseus is a fisherman.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: They've even taken that away from us.What we are.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Still they want us to love them anyway.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: One day, somebody's gonna have to say:
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Just like the day you came to me.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The storm brought me right to you.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I know you have questions, son.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I wish I had the answers.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The soldiers, what are they doing?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: MAN 3:In the name of the king and queen!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: SPYROS: They've declared war.War against the gods.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - Let's turn the boat around.SPYROS: No.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: MAN 1: Zeus, you must bring an endto this. They attack our temples!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: MAN 2:Now they dare to desecrate Zeus' image.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: WOMAN:We could reach out to them.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: MAN 3: An accommodation could be made.A truce!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...and they reward my love with defiance?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Endless years,I've watched from the underworld...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You created them for one reason...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But you love them too well.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And now I am forced to risebecause we are all threatened.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...and you will bathe in their aweand fear.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And we will grow strong again.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: He belongs in the underworld, not here.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You do not tell me where I belong.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You say it is love that feeds us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But you depend on their love.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I've only learned to live on their fear...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Zeus, our brother speaks the truth.Hear him.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Like children, they need to bereminded of the order of things.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - Are we the last boat to come in?MAN 1: No, captain.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: No. We found him off Paxosamongst our dead.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Let the palace figure outwhat to do with him.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: MAN 4:Because if we show the gods our love...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...they shall show us love in return.They shall.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: They gave us the corn in the fields,the sun in the sky.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: These are all gifts given to us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Gifts can be taken away.This will be taken away...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...if we do not pay love to our gods.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: If we do not, we stay in filth and misery,which we have brought upon ourselves.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: MAN 5: Move. Out of the way.PROKOPION: Our gods, we beg for the whip...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The beauty and clarity of servitude.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Man cannot rule man. You defy the godsand you will be punished.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: GENERAL:We lost many men, Your Majesty...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: To King Kepheus! To Queen Cassiopeia!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Our heroes who have daredto strike a blow at the heart of Zeus!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We have starved them of our prayers.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...the sun does not set over the ocean.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: That frown doesn't suit you, Andromeda.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Have something to drink.You'll feel more lively.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Have you seen what's happeningout there?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Have you even bothered to look?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ANDROMEDA: Hundreds of our menhave lost their lives...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You provoke the gods and you actas if there will be no consequence.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Well, what do you want?Should we be afraid?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Should we be tremblingand soiling ourselves in fear?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: What do we need of them?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: What could be more divine than her face?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: More beautifulthan all the women of Greece.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: More beautiful than Aphrodite herself.The Olympians should envy her.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - We are the gods now.- My queen. You're making a spectacle.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You are specks of dustbeneath our fingernails.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Your very breath is a gift from Olympus.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You have insulted powersbeyond your comprehension.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: HADES:What do you know of beauty?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: What is more beautiful than death?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Argos will be swept from the earth...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...you so foolishly compare to the gods.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Only her blood will sate the Kraken...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: This is the will of Zeus.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: HERMES:There is a demigod in Argos.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: This son knows no love for me.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: He's no different from any of the otherswho have turned their backs on us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: DRACO:For the last time, demigod, speak!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - I'm not a demigod.- Who are you? Why were you sent?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - He's not to be trusted.- What would you have me do? Draco.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: If it's true you are the son of Zeus...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I can't save you. I'm just a man.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: My lord, as terrible as it isto utter the words...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: No one should have to die for me.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Sire, we need to get the princessout of the city now.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - I'll find a place to hide her.- You can't hide from Hades.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: So says the bastard son of a god.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...everyone I loved was killed by a god.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: So, demigod, you have a visitor.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And how do you know me?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I've watched you all your life.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I guided you to your family.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: There are gods and there are men...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...and there are those of uswho are in between.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: That's not much of a curse.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I've lived for yearswatching my loved ones die.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I imagine you're sympatheticto that plight.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Am I the son of Zeus?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The story of your birthbegan with the rebellion of King Acrisius.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Mankind had grown tiredof the gods' mistreatment and cruelty.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Acrisius led a siege on Olympus.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It is said the other gods...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...wanted to simply lay waste to Acrisiusand his army...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Instead, he chose to make an exampleof Acrisius.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: He disguised himself as the king...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...and visited the chamberwhere the king's wife was sleeping.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: He ordered the execution of his wife...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I deny you the body you soiled...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The queen and her childwere cast into the sea.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Your mother was killed, but you...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I've watched over you ever since...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...waiting for the day when you will helpbring an end to the tyranny of the gods.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You were born to kill the Kraken.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I don't know why I was born...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But I know it's not the KrakenI wanna kill.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: How do I get to Hades?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...Hades will be weak enoughfor you to strike a deathly blow.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Only then will you have the revengeyou seek.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: IO:If the Kraken can be killed...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The witches are further awaythan the legion has ever been.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Zeus, forgive us for these affrontsand protect us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And you still believethey're going to help?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: MAN 1:And the shields. Come on, boys.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We've no chance, and you know it.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Here's who you drew into this, Perseus.An honor guard.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Young men who look goodon a reviewing stand...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Do you know what the Kraken is?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The Kraken is the end of us.A colossal, elemental beast.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.Even the gods fear it.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - And you, you're going to kill it?- Don't come.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - I don't need your help.- Of course not.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - But we have orders.MAN 3: Come, we need to leave!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Gentlemen, may our journey be long,filled with agony and torment...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...and may we all complain about itbitterly as old men.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - So what should we bring?- Bring everything.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: What makes you think the witcheswill tell us anything?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Oh, they'll tell us, or I'll kill them too.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - What is this?- Just leave it.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: MAN: Don't leave usto the mercy of the gods! Please.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Stay here. Please? Please? Help us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: WOMAN 2: You're just going tomake the gods angrier. Please.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Watch your mouth! Stay back. Stay back!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You'd think they might be thankful.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Maybe they're tired of being thankful.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: My brother and I have decided...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...to accompany you on your journey.- We have enough strangers here.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We can be of great help to you,trust me. You'll need us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Which one of your soldiersknows how to cut the impenetrable skin...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Which one of them knows the soft pointson a centaur's armor?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Which one of them knows which jugularto slice on a five-headed Hydra?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - The middle one.- The middle one. Good guess.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: My brother and I, we know how to kill.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - We enjoy it.- Lf you can keep up...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...and you don't mind dying, come along.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It is death who should be afraid of us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: HADES:We have an enemy in common.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: CALIBOS:What do you want from me?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Zeus' seed in your wife survived.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You murdered your wife for nothing.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Now Perseus hurls himselffrom Argos to destroy me.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - What would you have me do?- Zeus must think I serve him...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Until I possess my full power...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And I'll destroy Zeus for you.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Would you like us to wait?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Have you handled a sword before?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - There's been no need.- I see.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The weapon is a part of you.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Like the sting on a wasp.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Keep your balance at all times.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: There is a god in you.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I can do this as a man.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: No man has ever ridden one.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: BELO: Why does it always have to be...?- Shh!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - Who was that?- I don't know. Let's ask him.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: KUCUK: Back up! Back up! Back up!OZAL: There's more!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: IXAS: Three more!In the name of the gods, they're bigger.

text: I fought them in the legion.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: SOLON: They aren't human. Not anymore.Desert conjurers, cutthroats.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - Well, somebody should thank them.SOLON: What?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - What is it?- Venom. From Hades.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - Pray. Pray to Zeus for strength.- No. No.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: EUSEBIOS: Hear my prayer.Protect and heal your son.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: PROKOPION:We must turn our hearts to Hades!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I have the way out of our misery.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Hades has asked for the princess.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Sacrifice one for the life of the city.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Why do they remain silentwhile we suffer?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Why do they guard the womanwhose death will save us?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Is she better than any one of you?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We have long worshiped Zeus in Argos.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But it is Hadeswho now offers us salvation.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We must pray to the onewho showed us our sin...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: SOLON:When they get injured in battle...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...they replace their limbswith charwood and black magic.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: So how old is that one?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I don't care. I don't trust them.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: The Djinn have waited many years forthe one who will free them from the gods.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - He says he is no friend of the humans.- You don't say.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But the only way we can help Perseusis together.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - He's not ready to travel.- Time is slipping away, lo.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - He may be a demigod, but he's still mortal.- Feeling better?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Your pride is killing my men.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - You were given gifts. Use them.- Those gifts are a trap!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - I don't care what they are. Use them.- No.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I will not use that swordor anything that they give me!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: So we'll just continue to die.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: If I do this, I do it as a man.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But you are not just a man.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: A man cannot do this, Perseus.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: When you need your sword,it's in my bag.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: They tried to kill us. I'm not getting on it.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Well, we need to make up for lost time.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Not good enough.The eclipse is drawing near.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: IXAS:How close are we to the Norn Mountains?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: DRACO: It'll be two daysbefore we reach the witches.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: This thing is making me feel sick.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Trust me, it's better to be on onethan in one.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: When I spit in the eyes of the gods...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - What is this place?- The Garden of Stygia.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: This is where the Krakendefeated the Titans.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It's what Argos will look likewhen we fail.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Every step we takeis an insult to the gods.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Only ask what you need to know.Nothing more.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: DEINO: Give it to me.PEMPHREDO: Who is it?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Who is it? Who is it?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: DEINO:The eye. Give it to me.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We didn't come here to fight.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - We just have one question.PEMPHREDO: Young Perseus.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: DEINO: Son of Zeus.PEMPHREDO: So fresh.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - Flesh of a god.ENYO: Flesh of a god.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: So which one'sgonna answer my question?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ENYO: You want to know about the Kraken.DEINO: Kraken?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: PERSEUS: Let him go! Do it!DEINO: You wouldn't dare.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We cannot see the answerswithout the eye!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: How do we kill the Kraken?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But it is an impossible one.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Anything of flesh is killed by her gaze.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ENYO: Killed by her.- Her prison lies across the River Styx...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...at the edge of the underworld.ENYO: A Titan against a Titan.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: DRACO: She's no use against the Kraken.We can't control her.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ENYO: Clever boy.- Now the eye. Give us the eye.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But wait. There's more.Don't you want to know more?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ENYO:Your journey does not end well.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You will die, son of Zeus!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: EUSEBIOS:Why are the Djinn leaving us?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: IXAS: They believe we will all die.It's the prophecy.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: He was killed by a god.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: An unfortunate casualtyin a war men brought on themselves.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Men didn't murder my family.Your brother did.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You will not defeat the Kraken,much less Hades.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: If you continue this journey,you will die, and Argos will still fall.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: If you're so sure, why are you here?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Your blood is mine, Perseus,and that makes you a god.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It's time you came to Olympusand started living like one.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Rather die in the mud with those menthan live forever as a god.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Man's entire existenceis a gift of my grace.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Tell Hades I'll see him soon.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - I will not make this offer again.- Good.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Because I'd hate to refuse you twice.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Kucuk fashioned this shieldfrom the Scorpioch.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Stronger and lighter than any metal.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We all heard what the witches said.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But we can prove them wrong.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It wasn't the godsthat saved me up there.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: If you believe that we have a chance.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I never liked Argos much anyway.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Then we go to the underworld.We kill Medusa.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: SOLON: Now what?- We wait for Charon.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: So, what happens when we get there?
title: Clash of the Titans

text: So beautiful as to tempt Poseidon.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...she ran to Athena's temple thinkingthat the goddess would protect her.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Poseidon took her on the cold floor.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: She prayed to Athena for comfort...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: She made sureno one would ever want Medusa again.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: One look at the creature she has becomewill turn any living thing to stone.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I cannot assist you there.A curse prevents me.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It was Athena's one bit of solace to Medusaso that Medusa would never harm a woman.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Only men are allowed in the temple.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Though no man has ever made it out.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Medusa's got a tailand that's how she'll use it.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Feel her hunger in your gut.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Do you think she'll hand you her head?She won't be gracious about it.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: One look in her eyesand you'll turn to stone.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - Try not to enjoy this so much.- I'm trying to help you live.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I never thought I could reach this place.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I have a feeling I'll see her soon.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You brought us this far.Let's go the rest of the way.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: - How many coins did you get, Perseus?- Just the one.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I only knew one great man in my life.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And whatever the hell you are.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Someday someone was gonna have totake a stand.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Someday someonewas gonna have to say, "Enough. "
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And don't look this bitch in the eye.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Let them know men did this.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Just you and me, son of Zeus.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Perseus, you must go before it's too late.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But the fate of Argosis still in your hands.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: All my life you've been there.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: This part of the journeyyou must do alone.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...you're not just part man, part god...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It is time for the mortals to pay.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: My child waits to do your will.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Our suffering endswhen the beast is sated!
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Hades, we sacrifice our princessin your name.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You thought the Krakenwould bring you their prayers.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But the Kraken is my child.It feeds only me.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I command Olympus.Remember who you serve.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I have since you cheated me.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You sent me to the underworldto be hated...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: We need the love of humans.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Your reign is over, brother Zeus.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You'll watch while my blessed avengerdevours their hopes.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And then finally you'll know my pain.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: There is still a demigod in Argos...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ANDROMEDA:The boats are coming for us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I serve you better as a man.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You'll make a fine queen for them.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ZEUS:Olympus owes you a debt of gratitude.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: He's just sent back to the underworld.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Waiting for men to grow weak,and in their weakness, he grows stronger.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: It's mankind who holds the keyto Hades' rise.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: But now the world knowsa man can stop him.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: Of course, you had some help.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I wanted men to worship us again,but I didn't want it to cost me a son.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I don't suppose you'll reconsider my offerto take your place as one of us.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: I've got everything I need right here.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You may not want to be a god, Perseus...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...but after feats like yours,men will worship you.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: And if you insist on continuingthis mundane human existence...
title: Clash of the Titans

text: ...I won't have you do it alone.
title: Clash of the Titans

text: You're the son of Zeus, after all.
title: Clash of the Titans
